description: Barstow police arrested Montel Dion Sharp on Thursday morning after responding to two robberies wherein the suspect made off with cash from registers after threatening to shoot the clerks. Police allege that Sharp entered USA Gas, at 1400 East Main Street, late Wednesday night armed and left with cash from the register and three packs of Newport cigarettes.
text:
BARSTOW -- A man accused of two armed robberies of local gas station
convenience stores is behind bars and expected to be arraigned in a
Victorville courtroom Monday if charged by prosecutors.

Barstow police arrested Montel Dion Sharp on Thursday morning after responding
to two robberies wherein the suspect made off with cash from registers after
threatening to shoot the clerks.

In a photo provided by police, over $200 was pictured.

Police allege that Sharp entered USA Gas, at 1400 East Main Street, late
Wednesday night armed and left with cash from the register and three packs of
Newport cigarettes.

The clerk told police the suspect was armed with a "silver semi-automatic
handgun."

In the surveillance video, police say the suspect was wearing "blue nitrile
style gloves" and a "mask" covering the bottom of his face.

Several hours later, early Thursday morning, officers responded to another
armed robbery in the same area at Circle K, located at 1501 East Main Street.

Police allege Sharp entered the store with the same description of gun and
demanded cash from two registers.

Officers learned the suspect fled in a black Mercedes SUV, with left front end
damage, and a clerk said he had a tattoo between his eyes and on the left side
of his face.

Sgt. Jarell Gilmore found a black Mercedes SUV, with front end damage, in the
Desert Inn Motel parking lot just before 7 a.m., police said.

"Officer's maintained surveillance of the vehicle while detectives learned
that the vehicle was associated with room 197 of the motel," police said.
'Detectives knocked on the door of room 197 and talked to a male juvenile and
black male adult, later identified as Montel Dion Sharp, who had a tattoo
between his eyes and on the left side of his face. Detective Thomas Lewis saw
that Sharp also matched the general physical description of the robbery
suspect."

Sharp was detained and officers obtained a search warrant for the room and
SUV, and police allege that detectives found money and a silver colored BB
gun, along with clothing and the blue gloves that matched the description in
both robberies. A witness also identified Sharp as the person in the
surveillance video of both robberies, police said.

Sharp was booked on suspicion of two counts of robbery and making a criminal
threat.

Sharp is being held at High Desert Detention Center in Adelanto in lieu of
$200,000 bail, booking records show.

Jose Quintero may be reached at 760-951-6274 or
[JQuintero@VVDailyPress.com](mailto:JQuintero@VVDailyPress.com). Follow him on
Twitter at @DP_JoseQ.

title: Man accused of 2 armed robberies at Barstow businesses
html:
BARSTOW — A man accused of two armed robberies of local gas station convenience stores is behind bars and expected to be arraigned in a Victorville courtroom Monday if charged by prosecutors.

Barstow police arrested Montel Dion Sharp on Thursday morning after responding to two robberies wherein the suspect made off with cash from registers after threatening to shoot the clerks.

In a photo provided by police, over $200 was pictured.

Police allege that Sharp entered USA Gas, at 1400 East Main Street, late Wednesday night armed and left with cash from the register and three packs of Newport cigarettes.

The clerk told police the suspect was armed with a "silver semi-automatic handgun."

In the surveillance video, police say the suspect was wearing "blue nitrile style gloves" and a "mask" covering the bottom of his face.

Several hours later, early Thursday morning, officers responded to another armed robbery in the same area at Circle K, located at 1501 East Main Street.

Police allege Sharp entered the store with the same description of gun and demanded cash from two registers.

Officers learned the suspect fled in a black Mercedes SUV, with left front end damage, and a clerk said he had a tattoo between his eyes and on the left side of his face.

Sgt. Jarell Gilmore found a black Mercedes SUV, with front end damage, in the Desert Inn Motel parking lot just before 7 a.m., police said.

"Officer's maintained surveillance of the vehicle while detectives learned that the vehicle was associated with room 197 of the motel," police said. 'Detectives knocked on the door of room 197 and talked to a male juvenile and black male adult, later identified as Montel Dion Sharp, who had a tattoo between his eyes and on the left side of his face. Detective Thomas Lewis saw that Sharp also matched the general physical description of the robbery suspect."

Sharp was detained and officers obtained a search warrant for the room and SUV, and police allege that detectives found money and a silver colored BB gun, along with clothing and the blue gloves that matched the description in both robberies. A witness also identified Sharp as the person in the surveillance video of both robberies, police said.

Sharp was booked on suspicion of two counts of robbery and making a criminal threat.

Sharp is being held at High Desert Detention Center in Adelanto in lieu of $200,000 bail, booking records show.

Jose Quintero may be reached at 760-951-6274 or JQuintero@VVDailyPress.com. Follow him on Twitter at @DP_JoseQ.
